content.title: Permissive Hypotension in Ruptured AAA
content.definition: Deliberate acceptance of lower-than-normal blood pressure targets during resuscitation of ruptured aortic aneurysm to minimize ongoing hemorrhage while maintaining end-organ perfusion.

rationale.evidence: Observational data suggests improved survival with restrictive resuscitation in contained rupture

resuscitation_strategy.clot_preservation: Minimize manipulation, avoid aggressive IV fluids

intraoperative_considerations.pre_clamp: Maintain permissive hypotension until clamp applied
intraoperative_considerations.post_clamp: May now resuscitate to normal goals

learning_objectives: Explain physiologic rationale for permissive hypotension
Apply appropriate BP targets in ruptured AAA
Recognize when permissive hypotension is contraindicated
clinical_pearls: A talking, oriented patient with SBP 80 is better than a patient with SBP 120 who re-bleeds
Crystalloid is the enemy in ruptured AAA
Once clamp is on, resuscitate aggressively
